laboratory_examinations.findings: Hypercellular with 95 percent myeloperoxidase-positive blast cells, confirming diagnosis of AML without maturation (FAB subtype M1).
Hypercellular with 30 percent myeloperoxidase-positive blast cells containing Auer rods, indicating AML subtype M2 with eosinophilia (M2Eo). Cytogenetic evaluation revealed no abnormalities.
Normocellular with 35 percent myeloperoxidase-positive blast cells containing Auer rods, indicating AML subtype M2Eo. Cytogenetic evaluation revealed no abnormalities.
Mutation involving deletion of a cytosine residue at nucleotide 212 of CEBPA (212delC) in both Patients III-1 and III-5.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Identical mutation was absent in germ-line DNA and blood samples taken during remission for both patients.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 212delC mutation detected in peripheral-blood samples from Patients III-1 and III-5, but the duplication was undetectable in Patient III-1's sample.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Absent from germ-line DNA and not found in any samples from Patients II-3 and III-5.
